it.hackcaffebabe.ioutil.regexp

Class RegExp

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.hackcaffebabe.ioutil.regexp.RegExp

  • public final class RegExp
extends java.lang.Object
    Simple class that provide the most common regular expression validation.

      • containsNumbers

        public static boolean containsNumbers(java.lang.String stringToCheck)
                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Static method to check if a string contains some digits characters.
        Parameters:
        stringToCheck - String string to check with regular expression.
        Returns:
        Boolean true if string contains numbers, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if argument given is null or empty.

      • containsLetters

        public static boolean containsLetters(java.lang.String stringToCheck)
                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Static method to check if a string contains ONLY characters.
        Parameters:
        stringToCheck - String string to check with regular expression.
        Returns:
        Boolean true if string contains only letters, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if argument is null or empty.

      • containsSpecialCharacters

        public static boolean containsSpecialCharacters(java.lang.String stringToCheck,
                                                char... specialCharacters)
                                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method check if into the string given are present some of characters given whitespace character, short for [\t\n\x0b\r\f].
        Parameters:
        stringToCheck - String the string to check if some characters are present.
        specialCharacters - Character the characters to check.
        Returns:
        Boolean true if some characters are present into the string, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if argument given are null or empty characters.

      • isValidPhoneNumber

        public static boolean isValidPhoneNumber(java.lang.String phoneNumber)
                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Check if a String is a Phone number in format "+prefix{2}-number{10}".
        Parameters:
        phoneNumber - String the complete phone number in format "+prefix-number" ( without quotes ).
        Returns:
        Boolean true if the phone number is in format "+prefix-number" ( without quotes ).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if lengths given are less or equal of zero or phone number is null or empty.

      • isValidDate

        public static boolean isValidDate(java.lang.String date)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Check if a date is in format dd/mm/yyyy.
        Parameters:
        date - String string to check with regular expression.
        Returns:
        Boolean true if date is in format dd/mm/yyyy and his fields are correct, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if argument are null or empty.

      • isValidDate

        public static boolean isValidDate(java.lang.String date,
                                  char separator)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Check if a date is in format dd/mm/yyyy.
        Parameters:
        date - String string to check with regular expression.
        separator - Character that represent the separator of data fields. It can not be a digits.
        Returns:
        Boolean true if date is in format dd/mm/yyyy and his fields are correct, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if argument are null or empty.
